abstract: Kimberly-Clark reports an 8 percent decline in third-quarter net income to $432 million, or $1.09 a share, down from $469 million, or $1.14 a share, last year; company cites rising costs; also cuts its revenue outlook and the high end of its earnings outlook.
snippet: Kimberly-Clark reported an 8 percent decline in third-quarter net income Monday, citing rising costs. It also cut its revenue outlook and the high end of its earnings outlook.
lead_paragraph: Kimberly-Clark reported an 8 percent decline in third-quarter net income Monday, citing rising costs. It also cut its revenue outlook and the high end of its earnings outlook.

headline.main: Cost of Raw Materials Weakens Kimberly-Clark’s Earnings
headline.print_headline: Cost of Raw Materials Weakens Kimberly-Clark’s Earnings
